channel.title: Using two Axolotis ideas
channel.description:
Hi,
I am running two Axolotis now. I am sending the audio output from A into the audio input B.
Thanks to the community posts I got to edit both at the same time what is really great!
In order to improve my system I have some doubts about the best strategies to set everything. This is where I am digging now:
- Control patch changing together (connect using the micro usb? Which one? MIDI?)
- Not stoping sound when I swith between patches.
Any Ideas are welcoming.
Thanks!

item.title: Using two Axolotis ideas
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

I got 3 axos:

One I use only as a clock and sequencer, the other 2 does the sound work.

Read full topic

item.title: Using two Axolotis ideas
item.dc:creator: @xoanxil xoanxil
item.description:
@xoanxil wrote:

I am still thinking on it.

I was planning to use one Axoloti to generate sounds and the other as fx processor but I guess it limits anothet possibilities.

I am thinking on other strategies depending on how can I manage switching beetwen patches.

I have to try but also would like to know experience from community.

Read full topic

item.title: Using two Axolotis ideas
item.dc:creator: @BrianA
item.description:
@BrianA wrote:

Running multiple Axolotis is a topic of interest to me. Can you share details on your approach to split your application across two? Cheers!

Read full topic
